entry.title: Introducing Carbon Accounting for Sustainability with SAP
entry.content:
A new SAP Press publication is now available: “Introducing Carbon Accounting for Sustainability with SAP”!

Written by Julia Ackermann, Bastian Distler, Christoph Ernst, Jens Freiberg, Dominik Schwarz, Christopher Sessar, Mike Szabo, Nico Wottke, and Julia Zicke.

As sustainability is no longer just a compliance requirement but a core part of how modern organizations operate, carbon accounting becomes more and more important: the systematic measurement, management, and integration of greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions into finance and operational decision-making. Capturing environmental impact data and making it meaningful across complex ERP systems is challenging—but essential.

 

What the book offers:

Our book provides a clear, practical guide to how SAP enables carbon accounting to be fully integrated into business and finance processes, helping organizations turn carbon data into actionable insights.

Dive into SAP’s integrated sustainability portfolio and see how it transforms carbon data into enterprise-wide insight:

  • Connect across solutions: Explore how SAP Green Ledger, SAP Sustainability Footprint Management, and SAP Sustainability Data Exchange work together to provide a comprehensive view of carbon emissions and environmental impact across the organization.
  • From data to insight: Learn how carbon data from across your ERP landscape is captured, harmonized, and made usable for reporting, analysis, and strategic decision-making.
  • Integrate carbon into finance: Understand how SAP Green Ledger incorporates carbon metrics into journal entries, consolidation, and sustainability disclosures — connecting environmental performance directly to financial reporting.

Why it matters:
This book goes beyond theory, showing how carbon accounting is becoming a central part of enterprise strategy, not just a reporting requirement. It demonstrates how existing ERP and finance structures can be extended to make carbon footprints measurable, auditable, and actionable.

Whether for analyzing data, preparing disclosures, or optimizing finance processes, this book provides a roadmap for understanding and leveraging SAP’s carbon accounting and sustainability tools. It’s the resource to make carbon accounting tangible, integrated, and meaningful — turning environmental data into decisions that truly matter.

The book is available in the Ebook formats EPUB / PDF / online on https://www.sap-press.com/introducing-carbon-accounting-for-sustainability-with-sap_6054/.

entry.title: Is a function module call or method call categorized as clean core level A, B, C or D?
entry.content:
Hi new Developers forum

I am very exited about the new Clean Core Extensibility model and OSS note 3578329. Its almost like a new clean core paradigm that finally makes an upgrade to S4/HANA seem manageable.

But in the 3578329 oss notes list of technologies I miss SAP standard classes and function modules. 

Since the beginning of time SAP standard function modules were classified as Not Released, Internally Release and Released for Customers. What is the clean core level of a function module that is released for customers?

And what about classes and methods?

I have not yet had a change to use the ATC, will this tool make me wiser about the clean core level of a Z-program that use SAP standard functions and classes?

Regards Thomas

entry.title: Re: Events in Table Maintanance Generator, Sort Ascending...
entry.content:
This is the first post in the search results that allowed me to post a reply, so I'll add my solution here;

If you modify the table maintenance function group directly then you'll lose the changes if anyone regenerates the table maintenance dialog.  A better solution is to create an Implicit Enhancement at the end of Form FILL_EXTRACT (LSVIMF37).  This is included in every table maintenance dialog, but the enhancement will only be active for the function group that is chosen as the main program.  You can create multiple enhancements to cater for different table maintenance dialogs.

Here is the code:

  ENDIF.
"""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""""$"$\SE:(1) Form FILL_EXTRACT, End                                                                                                                            
*$*$-Start: (1)-------------------------------------------------$*$*
ENHANCEMENT 1  Zxxxxxxxx_MAINTENANCE.    "active version
"$"$\SE:(3) Form FILL_EXTRACT, End, Enhancement Zxxxxxxxx_MAINTENANCE, Start                                                                                
DATA: sorted_extract TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF Zxxxxxxxx.

IF vim_view_name = 'Zxxxxxxxx'.
  sorted_extract = extract[].
  SORT sorted_extract BY yyyyyyyy.
  extract[] = sorted_extract.
ENDIF.
"$"$\SE:(4) Form FILL_EXTRACT, End, Enhancement ZSUP_MATRIX_MAINTENANCE, End                                                                                  
ENDENHANCEMENT.
*$*$-End:   (1)--------------------------------------------$*$*
ENDFORM.                    "fill_extract

where xxxxxxxx is the view name, and yyyyyyyy is the field name to sort by.  If you only have one view in the table maintenance function group then you can omit the IF on line 8.

Hope this helps!

entry.title: Re: How to identify in debugging that document posted is...
entry.content:
The key field to check in Header Data (Structure BAPI_INCINV_CREATE_HEADER) is DOC_TYPE (Document Type). Typically

  • RE = Invoice
  • KG = Credit Memo

This is the most reliable indicator if you’re passing the BAPI header explicitly.

entry.title: Re: Outbound cancellation gererates new Req
entry.content:
In Intercompany (STO) scenarios, the supplying plant’s outbound delivery is directly tied to the buying plant’s purchase order. When you cancel an outbound delivery (VL02N) or remove a line, SAP interprets this as a change in supply confirmation. The system then deletes the original demand element (so it disappears from MD04 and VL10) and creates a new purchase requisition in the buying plant to re‑cover the requirement. That’s why you see the PO still open, but the demand “moved” into a new requisition.

This usually starts happening if supply assignment logic changed (e.g., a recent OSS Note, support pack, or S/4HANA upgrade adjusted how intercompany STOs are handled). Customizing in MM/SD integration was changed — especially around schedule line categories or requirements class. Availability check / MRP settings were altered (e.g., requirement reduction, rescheduling).

Check in the below areas

  • In vov6, check if the schedule line category used in your STO is set to “Generate Purchase Requisition” and how it behaves on deletion.
  • In OVZG / OVZH, See if requirement reduction is active. If SAP thinks the requirement is “fulfilled” when you cancel, it will remove the demand and create a new one.

entry.title: Re: WS00800238 - Is it possible to attach PO form in emai...
entry.content:
The standard behavior is Flexible Workflow (WS00800238) supports email notifications via Output Management and Email Templates. The workflow itself does not generate or attach the PO form (Smartform/Adobe form) by default. The PO form is normally generated through Output Management (BRF+ / NAST) when the PO is approved and released.

You can explore the below options

  • Configure Output Type for Purchase Orders (e.g., PURCHASE_ORDER). Set channel = Email and assign the Adobe Form. Once the PO is approved (via WS00800238), the output is triggered and the PO PDF is sent as an attachment to the vendor. This is the SAP‑recommended approach, because it separates workflow approval from document distribution.
  • If you want the PO form attached to the workflow email itself (not just vendor output), you need an enhancement. Implement a BAdI such as MMPUR_WORKFLOW_AGENTS_V2 or use SWO1 Business Object BUS2012 to fetch the PO form. Generate the PDF using FP_JOB_OPEN / FP_FUNCTION_MODULE_NAME (for Adobe forms) or SSF_FUNCTION_MODULE_NAME (for Smartforms). Attach the PDF to the workflow email step. This requires ABAP development.

entry.title: Re: getting error Reservation 0000000000 does not exist i...
entry.content:
The WMMBXY IDoc is designed to post goods movements (GI/GR) via function module MB_CREATE_GOODS_MOVEMENT. For planned goods issues (components in the BOM), the system references a reservation number created by the order. For unplanned goods issues, the reservation number is not required; but if the IDoc segment is filled incorrectly, SAP still tries to validate a reservation. When the field is passed as 0000000000, the system interprets it as “reservation expected” but cannot find one, hence the error.

Why it worked before and not now could be because of a change in MES mapping or an SAP support package/Note that tightened validation. Earlier, SAP may have ignored a blank/zero reservation field. After updates, the system now enforces stricter checks. This aligns with SAP Note 521427 – FAQ: IDocs for goods movements, which explains that incorrect population of reservation fields in WMMBXY can cause errors

entry.title: Re: In-House Kanban EWM without using planned or producti...
entry.content:
Some of the standard options are

With Event‑Driven Kanban (EDK), trigger when the Kanban is set to Empty, the system generates a replenishment element. Instead of creating a production order, you can configure it to create a stock transfer (from warehouse to supply area). This way, no planned/production order is needed — just a transfer posting.

If the above not meeting your requirement, try with In‑House Kanban with Stock Transfer. Replenishment strategy = Stock Transfer (not Production). When Kanban is empty, the system creates a transfer requirement / warehouse task for each component. Confirmation of the WT moves stock from warehouse to the production supply area (cell). When confirmed, Kanban is set to Full.

Configuration steps are

  • Go to PK05, and link plant, storage location, and supply area (production cell).
  • Go to PKMC, and assign material, supply area, and replenishment strategy. Choose Replenishment Strategy = Stock Transfer (not Production). Source storage location = warehouse, destination = production supply area.
  • In PK12N / PK13N, Define status sequence (Empty → In Process → Full). When set to Empty, system triggers WT creation.
  • If using EWM: Map supply area to PSA (Production Supply Area). Configure PSA determination so that when Kanban is empty, EWM creates WTs for each component.

entry.title: Re: Yet another "Unspecified provider error occurred. See...
entry.content:
@raada

The action decreaseBirthdate must return a result as it is defined as "result [1] $self". Please find an example below:

  METHOD set_status_accepted.

    " Modify in local mode: BO-related updates that are not relevant for authorization checks
    MODIFY ENTITIES OF /DMO/I_Travel_M IN LOCAL MODE
           ENTITY travel
              UPDATE FIELDS ( overall_status )
                 WITH VALUE #( FOR key IN keys ( %tky      = key-%tky
                                                 overall_status = 'A' ) ). " Accepted

    " Read changed data for action result
    READ ENTITIES OF /DMO/I_Travel_M IN LOCAL MODE
      ENTITY travel
         ALL FIELDS WITH
         CORRESPONDING #( keys )
       RESULT DATA(travels).

    result = VALUE #( FOR travel IN travels ( %tky      = travel-%tky
                                              %param    = travel ) ).

  ENDMETHOD.

entry.title: Handling YTD and Previous Month Selection in SAC
entry.content:
In SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC), I have a report based on SAP ECC / S/4 HANA with a Month_Year filter. Currently, selecting a month (e.g., June 2025) shows:

  • Current Value:  June 2025 

  • Previous Value: May 2025

The client now wants two separate filters:

  1. Current Month-Year (e.g., June 2025) → display YTD from Jan to selected month

  2. Previous Month-Year (e.g., May 2024) → display only the selected previous month

    I have created calculation input control but it doesn't provides YTD .

How can we implement this in SAC so that both filters work independently and show the expected values?

entry.title: Re: Business area not getting updated in F110 posted Docu...
entry.content:
Please note why the Business Area is missing in your case is because, in F110, the payment document is generated automatically from open vendor items. The system does not prompt for business area entry during payment run. Business area must be derived automatically (from customizing, substitution, or master data). Making business area “optional” in the GL account only affects manual postings (FB50, FB60, etc.). It does not influence F110, because F110 never asks the user for field entry. Besides, in ECC, business area is usually derived from:

  • Cost center / internal order / profit center assigned in the line item.
  • Rules in customizing (transaction OKB9 or substitution in FI).
  • Customer/vendor master data (if business area is assigned there).

If none of these are maintained, the payment document will have no business area.


To fix this, perform the following:

  • In transaction OKB9, assign business area to cost center, profit center, or company code. Or use FI substitution (OBBH) to populate business area during document posting.
  • Ensure vendor master has correct assignment (if you want business area derived from vendor).
  • Create a substitution rule in OBBH for application area FI → at document header or line item level. Condition: GL account = 2111215631. Substitution: Fill business area with required value. This ensures every payment document line for that GL gets a business area.
  • After substitution/derivation is set, rerun F110. The payment document should now carry the business area.

entry.title: Q3 2025 Quarterly Release Highlights: SAP BTP Security and Identity & Access Management
entry.content:
Our development teams have been busy again this quarter, delivering a range of new features and enhancements across SAP BTP Security and Identity & Access Management.

Want the full overview? You can always find a list of all new feature announcements for SAP Cloud Identity Services in the SAP Cloud Identity Services Release Notes on the SAP Help Portal.

SAP Cloud Identity Services: CAPTCHA protection

Tenant administrators can enable CAPTCHA protection for the phone verification pages of the application. See the setup guidelines here:

  • Enable Google reCAPTCHA for Application Forms 
  • Enable MTCaptcha for Application Forms

SAP Cloud Identity Services: Provided APIs

Cloud Identity Services now expose the Identity Directory API, Corporate Identity Providers API, and SAP Cloud Identity Services Application Directory as provided APIs for the Administration Console application. These can be used for principal propagation.
Learn more in the documentation: Consume APIs from the Administration Console.

Identity Directory Service and Identity Provisioning Service: Support for extension schemas towards additional SAP business applications

Default transformations of the following connectors now support attributes from the SAP extension schema for groups, including application ID, type, and supported operations:

  • SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central Payroll
  • Cloud Foundry UAA Server
  • Procurement Data Warehouse

You can find details in the SAP Cloud Identity Services Release Notes.

Identity Provisioning Service: Enhanced real-time provisioning logs

Real-time sync execution results for source systems are now displayed in a dedicated table on the real-time provisioning logs screen.

Additional information is provided in the Reason column when an entity is skipped or not provisioned.
Check the guide on how to Monitor Real-Time Logs .

Custom Domain Service: New console client command and new optional parameter for generate-csr

Two new features are available for working with custom domains:

  • New console command: Use the add-domain-certificate command to add an already uploaded certificate of a different type to the SSL host. For example, if an RSA certificate is already bound to the SSL host, you can now also add an ECC certificate—and vice versa. For details, read  add-domain-certificate.
  • New parameter: The --elliptic-curve parameter can now be used with the generate-csr command, allowing you to specify an elliptic curve for ECC algorithms. Get the details at generate-csr.

Authorization and Trust Management Service: Automatic Signing Key Rotation for Access Tokens

We’re now offering automatic rotation of the signing key for access tokens. It is disabled by default; when enabled, SAP BTP rotates the signing key periodically. See Rotate Signing Keys of Access Tokens for details. As of January 2026, we plan to enable this feature by default for new subaccounts

Stay connected

Want to stay up to date on our services? Join our SAP BTP Security and SAP Cloud Identity Services communities!

entry.title: Re: Add additional column to the Va02,Va03 incompletion log.
entry.content:
The incompletion procedures define which fields are checked, but not the layout of the incompletion log screen itself. The screen layout (columns displayed) is hard‑coded in SAP standard and cannot be changed via customizing.

Two options are there to meet this requirement. They are

You would need to enhance the incompletion log screen program (SAPMV45A, screen 4209) or use an implicit enhancement in the relevant function module (SD_INCOMP_LOG_DISPLAY). This is a technical development (ABAP + screen enhancement), not a customizing step.

Instead of adding a column, you can add your extra information to the “Description” field dynamically (via user exit USEREXIT_INCOMPLETE_DOCUMENT in include MV45AFZZ). This way, the additional info is visible without changing the screen layout. This is the most common workaround because it avoids modifying the SAP standard screen.

entry.title: Re: Data Transfer Tool
entry.content:
Hi @SwapnamolShaji thank you for the great SAP Blog post!
I’d love to add two small points, if I may:

  1. Choosing the right migration tool – It’s crucial to understand the existing system landscape. For example, if you are moving from an SAP ECC and C4C setup to an S/4 and SAP Sales/Service Cloud V2 landscape, you need to pay close attention to the external IDs (UUID) of business partners, since they are linked to all transactional data. In this context, it might be worth considering a more “classic” migration approach using Data Workbench with import/export and possibly APIs.

  2. What does a “phased approach in the Data Transfer Tool” mean? – In this scenario, all data is first loaded into SAP Sales and Service Cloud V2. Once that has been completed, you’ll need to adapt the authorization concept for the users in the source system, so that only the users intended to work with the V2 system in the first phase have the right access. It’s also important to keep in mind that the V2 system does not write back into V1.

Best regards,
Markus

entry.title: Re: I have done the PGI and invoice also, but inventory i...
entry.content:
When you post PGI (Post Goods Issue) in SAP, the system should immediately reduce stock in the delivering plant/storage location. If inventory is not reduced even after PGI, it usually points to one of these issues:

  • Delivery would not have PGId (note, you can invoice even before PGI in standard). Check via VA02 document flow whether after delivery, you are able to see material document reference. Share a screen shot of the document flow if you are not sure on this.
  • Wrong Movement type. In standard, 601 is the standard movement type for goods issue. If the system considers other movement type, system may not reduce inventory. Check what schedule line category is flowing in sales order. Then, go to VOV6, select that schedule line category and check which movement type is assigned.
  • If it’s consignment, subcontracting, or stock transport, the goods may have moved into a special stock category (e.g., customer consignment stock) instead of reducing unrestricted stock. Use MBEWH/MMBE to check stock by special stock indicator.

entry.title: Manual Accrual getting reversed at the time of Delta Accrual
entry.content:
I have posted a Manual Delta Accrual of 300 $ as part of the data migration activity.

Later we have transactions in S4 leading to an accrual of 400 $, but when this accrual is posted by a Delta Accrual run, the 300$ posted by the manul delta accrual is reversed with condition RED2.

Is there a way to stop this reversal? I want the accruals both manual and by system to be reversed only at the time of settlement run.

entry.title: System allows submission even when a mandatory field is left empty due to document deletion
entry.content:
Hello community folks,
I have a query related to Successfactors SAP SuccessFactors Onboarding #onboarding additional data collection step

In the Additional Data Collection (ADC) step of the candidate, the system allows submission even when a mandatory field is left empty due to document deletion. We have created a custom UI for uploading the highest education and work experience document. Fields have been kept as mandatory but still the candidate can proceed without any error post deleting the document.

Steps to Reproduce:

  1. Candidate navigates to the ADC step and clicks on "Please Upload your Education and Experience Details."
  2. Candidate uploads a document in the "Please Upload Highest Education Document" field (which is marked as mandatory).
  3. Candidate clicks Submit — the status updates to Completed.
  4. Candidate revisits the "Please Upload your Education and Experience Details" section.
  5. Candidate deletes the previously uploaded document from the "Please Upload Highest Education Document" field.
  6. Candidate clicks Close, then clicks on Submit in the ADC step.

The system should validate the mandatory field and prevent submission, displaying an error message indicating that the "Highest Education Document" is required. Instead, the system allows submission without any error message, and the workflow proceeds to the next step despite the mandatory field being empty.

Thanking you for reply and help in advance.

entry.title: Get your Kyma-Cluster NAT Gateway IPs
entry.content:
The SAP BTP, Kyma Runtime received an update that provides the NAT Gateway IP information directly in the Kyma Cluster. This makes it very easy to retrieve this information and use it for allow list and Firewall configuration. 

The NAT Gateway IPs are now available in the ConfigMap "kyma-info" in the kyma-system namespace. 

This makes it possible to retrieve it via the Dashboard as well as via the kubectl CLI and API:

entry.title: Re: MDG replication of field not successful
entry.content: Yes, this field should be never used in s4hana environment. Please check with business side the purpose they are using this field for. And check if you can find some other field to replace it.

entry.title: Re: Manual Accrual getting reversed at the time of Delta...
entry.content:
When you run a Delta Accrual, the system recalculates the total accrual requirement based on business volume and conditions. It then reverses all previously posted accruals (manual or automatic) using condition type RED2, and reposts the new delta amount. That’s why your manual delta accrual of 300 USD is being reversed — the system doesn’t distinguish between “migration/manual” and “system” accruals once they sit in the same accrual group.

Why it is happening is because, in customizing, the Condition Type Group for Accruals defines which condition types are reversed during delta accrual runs. If your manual delta accrual condition (e.g. RENT/REA1) is included in that group, the system will always reverse it with RED2 in the next delta run. SAP’s design assumption is that only final settlement should leave accruals standing; delta runs are meant to keep the accrual balance aligned with current business volume.

Few choices which you can explore

Don’t include the manual accrual condition in the accrual group. If you leave your manual condition type (e.g. RENT) out of the accrual group, the delta run won’t reverse it. Downside: it also won’t be considered in automatic settlement, so you’d need to handle reversal manually at final settlement.

Use a separate adjustment condition type. Instead of posting migration adjustments as “manual delta accruals,” create a dedicated rebate adjustment condition (e.g. REJ1). This condition is not part of the accrual group, so it won’t be touched by delta runs. At final settlement, it will still be cleared.

Another SAP‑recommended approach is to create a business volume document representing the adjustment. Then the delta accrual run will naturally include it in its calculation, and you won’t need a manual delta accrual at all

entry.title: Re: How to do background scheduling with clean core, including Fiori apps, replacing se38 reports
entry.content:
Hi @Shashank_Gupta_BTP 

Sorry for my late reply. I needed to do some checking on this one.

The examples you showed were among others application job catalog entry SAP_FIN_GL_AUTO_CLR, which is in fact se38 program based, not class-based, as we tried to do here, for again, staying in ABAP Cloud.

The result is only set if the application job created a spool. This would not be possible for BTP ABAP environment or public cloud. For on-premise or private cloud, I honestly don't know what would happen if you add some WRITE command into your application job class. It would need to be Standard ABAP and not ABAP Cloud, thus making it not clean core level A anymore. So you could just try that, or other ways like RSPO_SR_OPEN/WRITE/CLOSE (not sure those would work either, but they are stable classic API from the cloudification repository).

Another option you could do is make use of emails and for example email an attachment, at the end of your job execution.

But as far as the Result column goes in the standard app, that is for spool only, as far as I know. 

Regards

entry.title: Authentification required to access the ATO service

Dear Community,

However, when I enter my S/4HANA Public Cloud development tenant credentials, the authentication fails with the error “Incorrect credentials”—despite entering the correct details.

I am currently using a destination with authentication type set to BasicAuthentication.

I found a similar issue  but seems relevant for On-Premise systems, but I’m not sure which role in S/4HANA Public Cloud provides the ATO-related authorization objects. Additionally, the error message “Incorrect credentials” is misleading, since the credentials are valid for logging into the development tenant.

Has anyone else faced this issue? If so, how did you resolve it?

Thank you!

Best regards,
Karthik

entry.title: Re: Custom Money field is not working as expected
entry.content: Krishna, there are so many things that could be the issue here, more context is needed. I would confirm the currency conversion rate because if that is set to 1, the rates would be the same. Second, I would expect you have a custom formula in custom field, you need to ensure that all the fields there are properly calculating and that there is not a problem with a field within the formula. I might suggest you start by redefining the formula by deconstructing it into its pieces and recalculating the bonus to pinpoint where it may be going wrong. Also, it would be helpful to show screenshots of the custom field from the column designer and then show what the form looks like when you see it in functional vs. local. Maybe I can help troubleshoot if you provide more information.

entry.content:
Good day,

I've been trying to pass data out (output) of an Automation, into another one, and I'm not able to.  My Output Parameter was always blank.  I had to merge my logic into a single Automation to achieve my solution.

Sample Process:

Parameters of getData Automation:

I found some info that the best way to read from a local Excel file is to use the Excel Cloud Link activity, which is recommended to use a "any" type variable.  This type of variable does not seem to support LISTS either.  I then learned that the TRY statement creates an isolated local "visibility" layer, so I created my "global" variable outside this TRY later.  I tried different ways to pass the Excel data to my global variable (both work) but I cannot pass the data to my Automation Output Parameter.

Can someone confirm that LISTS are not supported as Parameters of Automations?

Thank you.

entry.title: Re: PO header and item text do not appear in printed form...
entry.content:
Please check in the following areas

Path: SPRO → Materials Management → Purchasing → Messages → Texts for Messages → Define Texts for Purchase Orders. Each text type (header, item) must be assigned to the output type and language. Often, only EN/FR/DE are maintained; IT may be missing. Check if the text ID (e.g. F01, F02) is linked to your PO form for Italian.

The PO print program (usually SAPFM06P with Smartform MEDRUCK or custom Z-form) controls which languages are supported. If Italian is not included in the form’s language key or translation objects, the text will be skipped. Check in SE71/SE78 (Smartforms) or SFP (Adobe) whether Italian translations exist for the text elements.

Go to SE75 and verify that the text object used for PO header/item texts has Italian maintained. If not, the system can’t retrieve the text in IT even if it exists in the PO.

Even if vendor and PO are in Italian, the output message language (NAST table, field SPRAS) is decisive. Check in ME9F or NAST whether the message is really being generated in IT. Sometimes the system defaults to logon language or company code language if Italian is not fully supported.

id like to create Purchase orders with Custom Price Condition that is %-Based using the API:

According to the WSDL the Structure is:

<PriceCondition>

</PricingCondition>

<!--Optional:-->
</PricingCondition>

kind regards, 

Philipp

entry.title: Re: SCE For material Discontinue
entry.content:
When you set a material to “Discontinued,” it often means no valid standard cost estimate or valuation price is maintained for the future period. The system still tries to valuate the material during SCE, but finds no price.
In the Accounting 1 view of the material master, fields like Standard Price (S) or Moving Average Price (V) may be blank or outdated. If no valid entry exists in the valuation area for the relevant period, the system cannot determine a price.
The error “No price could be determined” (CK465) means that none of the strategies in the valuation variant (e.g. standard cost estimate, planned price 1/2/3, moving average) succeeded in finding a value
You mentioned you will “arrange it in November 2025.” If you are running SCE before that date, the system has no valid cost estimate for the current period, so it errors out.

Perform the below steps to fix it

  • Ensure a valid Standard Price or Moving Average Price is maintained for the material in the relevant plant/company code. If the material is discontinued but still needed for processing, you can enter a Planned Price (Planned Price 1/2/3) for costing purposes.
  • Run a cost estimate (CK11 or CK40N) for the material and mark/release it so that a valid standard cost exists.
  • Make sure the valuation strategy (OKKN) includes a fallback (e.g. Planned Price 1) if no standard cost is found.

entry.title: Re: Manual Accrual getting reversed at the time of Delta...
entry.content:
Hi @priya_sshekhar, 

If the business agrees, you can post your manual Delta Accrual on the same day as the Final Settlement date or the last day of the contract.
In that case, you may use the posting date and document date as usual, and the system will only reverse the remaining accrual balance at the time of the Final Settlement - ensuring proper alignment of postings.

However, if your Partial or Final Settlement needs to account for source documents from a legacy system (i.e., if your open accrual balance includes legacy volumes), then you will need to:

  • Migrate those legacy source documents as pro forma entries,

  • Include them in your business volume,

  • And allow CCM to calculate the settlement amount accordingly.

In this case, you won’t need to post a manual Delta Accrual, but rather you’ll need to execute an automatic Delta Accrual based on the combination of:

  • Migrated legacy documents, and

  • Ongoing business volume captured in S/4HANA.

Regards, 
Gauthier Victor

entry.title: Re: How to rewrite this ABAP SQL join via the CDS associations and SQL Path Expression?
entry.content:
Instead of defining the SQL Path Expression in the FROM part, just have it in the list of selected columns:

SELECT DISTINCT PrelimBillingDocument,
                i_prelimbillingdocumentitem~\_salesdocument\_zzpurchaseorderitemacctassign[ MANY TO EXACT ONE ]-costcenter
  FROM I_PrelimBillingDocumentItem
  WHERE PrelimBillingDocument = 'PBD0000061'
    AND i_prelimbillingdocumentitem~\_salesdocument\_zzpurchaseorderitemacctassign[ MANY TO EXACT ONE ]-costcenter <> ' '
  INTO TABLE @DATA(lt_billing_doc_to_cost_center).

entry.title: How to use Version Management with GitHub Repository
entry.content:
Downloading and Installing the GIT Application

  • Download the GIT application from : https://git-scm.com/ 
  • Download and install the GIT application on the BO Server. We will need this to configure later.

Configuration of Github 

  • Create an Account on Github - > https://github.com/ 
  • Create a Public repository on the Github which we want to use for Version Management.

Token Generation in Github and Maintaining the default branch

  1. Navigate to the Profile on the https://github.com/settings/profile
  2. Scroll Down to <> Developer Setting.
  3. Next Select the Personal Access Tokens > Tokens ( classic)
  4. Generate new token ( classic)

     

  5. Under Scopes Select Repo:

To check the default Branch. Navigate to Settings and then Repository : https://github.com/settings/repositories 

Master is been set as default

 

Configuring Version Management in CMC to use Github

  1. In CMC Home page, select Applications.
  2. Select Version Management.
  3. Choose Git from the Version Management Systems list.
  4. Click the checkbox Use as Default VMS.
  5. Under Protocol use HTTP(s). (HTTP is used if you want to completely use local GIT)
  6. Below are the parameters that needs to be maintained 


    Parameters  Details
    User nameEnter the username of the Github account that was used to create repository
    GitHub personal access tokens (classic)Enter the token generated above from Github
    GitHub Remote Repository URLEnter the link to the Repository that was created on Github. <https://github.com/<username>/<Repository Name>
    Workspace DirectoryEnter the Path where you want to save your workspace.
    Repository NameEnter a name for your Github repository. Should be the same that is been created in Github. <Repository Name>
    GIT Install PathEnter the install directory of Git. <install_dir>\Git\bin
    Default Branch NameEnter the Default Branch name that is been maintained in your profile on github. 

  7. Once all the Details are maintained, Click on SAVE
  8. Restart the APS hosting the Version Management Services. 
  9. Navigate to the CMC > and access the Version Management Application
